title: Aesculus hippocastanum
summary: Aesculus hippocastanum, the horse chestnut,[1][2][3] is a species of flowering plant in the soapberry and lychee family Sapindaceae. It is a large deciduous, synoecious (hermaphroditic-flowered) tree.[4] It is also called horse-chestnut,[5] European horsechestnut,[6] buckeye,[7] and conker tree.[8] It is sometimes called Spanish chestnut.[7][9][10] This name is typically used for Castanea sativa.[11][12]
